recipe.title: Fried pork belly with parsley sauce

task.taskString: Boil the potatoes for 15 minutes or untill tender when tested with a skewer.
task.alertString: The potatoes have finished boiling. Drain the water from the pot, and let the potatoes dry in the pot with the lid off.

task.taskString: Cut the pork belly into 0.5 cm thick slices if you want the pork to be crispy. Thicker slices will often produce pork that is softer inside. Dip the slices dry with kitchen roll.
Peel the potatoes and submerge them in in a pot filled with water. Add salt to the pot, and close it with a lid.

To make the parsley sauce, melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in the flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually whisk in the cold milk, then simmer, stirring continuously until the sauce has thickened to your desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper, then stir through the parsley.

Warm your pan to high heat. If the pork belly is very lean, then add a bit of oil to the pan. Lay the pork belly slices on the pan and brown them for 30 to 60 seconds on each side. Turn down to medium heat and grill them untill they are golden and crispy, while frequently turning the slices. Take the pork belly slices off the pan and place them on a paper towel, so that they are drained of excess fat. Sprinkle with salt.

Serve the potatoes and pork with the parsley sauce drizzled over and a sprinkling of extra parsley. \n Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Maecenas rutrum a diam ac rutrum.
